IPUCN22L000000000.title: Labor Productivity for Utilities: Utilities (NAICS 22) in the United States
IPUCN22L000000000.notes: Labor productivity describes the efficiency at which labor hours are utilized in producing output of goods and services, measured as output per hour of labor.

IPUCN22L001000000.title: Labor Productivity for Utilities: Utilities (NAICS 22) in the United States
IPUCN22L001000000.notes: Labor productivity describes the efficiency at which labor hours are utilized in producing output of goods and services, measured as output per hour of labor.

IPUCN22L010000000.title: Hours Worked for Utilities: Utilities (NAICS 22) in the United States
IPUCN22L010000000.notes: Labor hours are measured as annual hours worked by all workers, including wage and salary workers, unincorporated self-employed workers, and unpaid family workers, in the production of goods and services.

IPUCN22L020000000.title: Labor Compensation for Utilities: Utilities (NAICS 22) in the United States
IPUCN22L020000000.notes: Labor compensation, defined as payroll plus supplemental payments, is a measure of the cost to the employer of securing the services of labor. Payroll includes salaries, wages, commissions, dismissal pay, bonuses, vacation and sick leave pay, and compensation in kind. Supplemental payments include both legally required expenditures and payments for voluntary programs. The legally required portion consists primarily of federal old age and survivors’ insurance, unemployment compensation, and workers’ compensation. Payments for voluntary programs include all programs not specifically required by legislation, such as the employer portion of private health insurance and pension plans.

IPUCN22L021000000.title: Labor Compensation for Utilities: Utilities (NAICS 22) in the United States
IPUCN22L021000000.notes: Labor compensation, defined as payroll plus supplemental payments, is a measure of the cost to the employer of securing the services of labor. Payroll includes salaries, wages, commissions, dismissal pay, bonuses, vacation and sick leave pay, and compensation in kind. Supplemental payments include both legally required expenditures and payments for voluntary programs. The legally required portion consists primarily of federal old age and survivors’ insurance, unemployment compensation, and workers’ compensation. Payments for voluntary programs include all programs not specifically required by legislation, such as the employer portion of private health insurance and pension plans.

IPUCN22L200000000.title: Hours Worked for Utilities: Utilities (NAICS 22) in the United States
IPUCN22L200000000.notes: Labor hours are measured as annual hours worked by all workers, including wage and salary workers, unincorporated self-employed workers, and unpaid family workers, in the production of goods and services.

IPUCN22L201000000.title: Hours Worked for Utilities: Utilities (NAICS 22) in the United States
IPUCN22L201000000.notes: Labor hours are measured as annual hours worked by all workers, including wage and salary workers, unincorporated self-employed workers, and unpaid family workers, in the production of goods and services.

IPUCN22T010000000.title: Real Sectoral Output for Utilities: Utilities (NAICS 22) in the United States
IPUCN22T010000000.notes: Real sectoral output is the output produced that has been adjusted for changes in inventory (gross output) and the removal of goods and services shipped among related establishments, which are referred to as intra-industry and intra-sectoral shipments.

IPUCN22T011000000.title: Real Sectoral Output for Utilities: Utilities (NAICS 22) in the United States
IPUCN22T011000000.notes: Real sectoral output is the output produced that has been adjusted for changes in inventory (gross output) and the removal of goods and services shipped among related establishments, which are referred to as intra-industry and intra-sectoral shipments.

IPUCN22T050000000.title: Sectoral Output Price Deflator for Utilities: Utilities (NAICS 22) in the United States
IPUCN22T050000000.notes: An output deflator is an index of the change over time in the price of sectoral output relative to a base period.

IPUCN22T051000000.title: Sectoral Output Price Deflator for Utilities: Utilities (NAICS 22) in the United States
IPUCN22T051000000.notes: An output deflator is an index of the change over time in the price of sectoral output relative to a base period.

IPUCN22T300000000.title: Sectoral Output for Utilities: Utilities (NAICS 22) in the United States
IPUCN22T300000000.notes: Sectoral output is the current dollar value of output that has been adjusted for changes in inventory (gross output) and the removal goods and services shipped among related establishments, which are referred to as intra-industry and intra-sectoral shipments.

IPUCN22T301000000.title: Sectoral Output for Utilities: Utilities (NAICS 22) in the United States
IPUCN22T301000000.notes: Sectoral output is the current dollar value of output that has been adjusted for changes in inventory (gross output) and the removal goods and services shipped among related establishments, which are referred to as intra-industry and intra-sectoral shipments.

IPUCN22U100000000.title: Unit Labor Costs for Utilities: Utilities (NAICS 22) in the United States
IPUCN22U100000000.notes: Unit labor costs represent the cost of labor required to produce one unit of output. The unit labor cost indexes are computed by dividing an index of nominal industry labor compensation by an index of real industry output.

IPUCN22U101000000.title: Unit Labor Costs for Utilities: Utilities (NAICS 22) in the United States
IPUCN22U101000000.notes: Unit labor costs represent the cost of labor required to produce one unit of output. The unit labor cost indexes are computed by dividing an index of nominal industry labor compensation by an index of real industry output.

IPUCN22U110000000.title: Labor Compensation for Utilities: Utilities (NAICS 22) in the United States
IPUCN22U110000000.notes: Labor compensation, defined as payroll plus supplemental payments, is a measure of the cost to the employer of securing the services of labor. Payroll includes salaries, wages, commissions, dismissal pay, bonuses, vacation and sick leave pay, and compensation in kind. Supplemental payments include both legally required expenditures and payments for voluntary programs. The legally required portion consists primarily of federal old age and survivors’ insurance, unemployment compensation, and workers’ compensation. Payments for voluntary programs include all programs not specifically required by legislation, such as the employer portion of private health insurance and pension plans.

IPUCN22U120000000.title: Hourly Compensation for Utilities: Utilities (NAICS 22) in the United States
IPUCN22U120000000.notes: Hourly compensation is the sum of wage and salary accruals and supplements to wages and salaries per hour of labor services used to produce output. Wage and salary accruals consist of the monetary remuneration of employees. Supplements to wages and salaries consist of employer contributions for social insurance and employer payments (including payments in kind) to private pension and profit-sharing plans, group health and life insurance plans, privately administered workers' compensation plans.

IPUCN22U121000000.title: Hourly Compensation for Utilities: Utilities (NAICS 22) in the United States
IPUCN22U121000000.notes: Hourly compensation is the sum of wage and salary accruals and supplements to wages and salaries per hour of labor services used to produce output. Wage and salary accruals consist of the monetary remuneration of employees. Supplements to wages and salaries consist of employer contributions for social insurance and employer payments (including payments in kind) to private pension and profit-sharing plans, group health and life insurance plans, privately administered workers' compensation plans.

IPUCN22W000000000.title: Output per Worker for Utilities: Utilities (NAICS 22) in the United States
IPUCN22W000000000.notes: Output per worker is ratio of the amount of goods and services produced relative to the number of workers who produced that output for a given period of time.

IPUCN22W001000000.title: Output per Worker for Utilities: Utilities (NAICS 22) in the United States
IPUCN22W001000000.notes: Output per worker is ratio of the amount of goods and services produced relative to the number of workers who produced that output for a given period of time.

IPUCN22W010000000.title: Employment for Utilities: Utilities (NAICS 22) in the United States
IPUCN22W010000000.notes: Employment is the total number of wage and salary workers, unincorporated self-employed workers, and unpaid family workers working within business establishments. An individual who works multiple jobs at separate establishments would have each job included in the number of employees.

IPUCN22W200000000.title: Employment for Utilities: Utilities (NAICS 22) in the United States
IPUCN22W200000000.notes: Employment is the total number of wage and salary workers, unincorporated self-employed workers, and unpaid family workers working within business establishments. An individual who works multiple jobs at separate establishments would have each job included in the number of employees.

IPUCN22W201000000.title: Employment for Utilities: Utilities (NAICS 22) in the United States
IPUCN22W201000000.notes: Employment is the total number of wage and salary workers, unincorporated self-employed workers, and unpaid family workers working within business establishments. An individual who works multiple jobs at separate establishments would have each job included in the number of employees.

IPUCN2212U100000000.notes: Unit labor costs represent the cost of labor required to produce one unit of output. The unit labor cost indexes are computed by dividing an index of nominal industry labor compensation by an index of real industry output.

IPUCN2212U101000000.title: Unit Labor Costs for Utilities: Natural Gas Distribution (NAICS 2212) in the United States
IPUCN2212U101000000.notes: Unit labor costs represent the cost of labor required to produce one unit of output. The unit labor cost indexes are computed by dividing an index of nominal industry labor compensation by an index of real industry output.

IPUCN2212U110000000.title: Labor Compensation for Utilities: Natural Gas Distribution (NAICS 2212) in the United States
IPUCN2212U110000000.notes: Labor compensation, defined as payroll plus supplemental payments, is a measure of the cost to the employer of securing the services of labor. Payroll includes salaries, wages, commissions, dismissal pay, bonuses, vacation and sick leave pay, and compensation in kind. Supplemental payments include both legally required expenditures and payments for voluntary programs. The legally required portion consists primarily of federal old age and survivors’ insurance, unemployment compensation, and workers’ compensation. Payments for voluntary programs include all programs not specifically required by legislation, such as the employer portion of private health insurance and pension plans.

IPUCN2212U120000000.title: Hourly Compensation for Utilities: Natural Gas Distribution (NAICS 2212) in the United States
IPUCN2212U120000000.notes: Hourly compensation is the sum of wage and salary accruals and supplements to wages and salaries per hour of labor services used to produce output. Wage and salary accruals consist of the monetary remuneration of employees. Supplements to wages and salaries consist of employer contributions for social insurance and employer payments (including payments in kind) to private pension and profit-sharing plans, group health and life insurance plans, privately administered workers' compensation plans.

IPUCN2212U121000000.title: Hourly Compensation for Utilities: Natural Gas Distribution (NAICS 2212) in the United States
IPUCN2212U121000000.notes: Hourly compensation is the sum of wage and salary accruals and supplements to wages and salaries per hour of labor services used to produce output. Wage and salary accruals consist of the monetary remuneration of employees. Supplements to wages and salaries consist of employer contributions for social insurance and employer payments (including payments in kind) to private pension and profit-sharing plans, group health and life insurance plans, privately administered workers' compensation plans.

IPUCN2212W000000000.title: Output per Worker for Utilities: Natural Gas Distribution (NAICS 2212) in the United States
IPUCN2212W000000000.notes: Output per worker is ratio of the amount of goods and services produced relative to the number of workers who produced that output for a given period of time.

IPUCN2212W001000000.title: Output per Worker for Utilities: Natural Gas Distribution (NAICS 2212) in the United States
IPUCN2212W001000000.notes: Output per worker is ratio of the amount of goods and services produced relative to the number of workers who produced that output for a given period of time.

IPUCN2212W010000000.title: Employment for Utilities: Natural Gas Distribution (NAICS 2212) in the United States
IPUCN2212W010000000.notes: Employment is the total number of wage and salary workers, unincorporated self-employed workers, and unpaid family workers working within business establishments. An individual who works multiple jobs at separate establishments would have each job included in the number of employees.

IPUCN2212W200000000.title: Employment for Utilities: Natural Gas Distribution (NAICS 2212) in the United States
IPUCN2212W200000000.notes: Employment is the total number of wage and salary workers, unincorporated self-employed workers, and unpaid family workers working within business establishments. IPUCN221210W201000000.notes: Employment is the total number of wage and salary workers, unincorporated self-employed workers, and unpaid family workers working within business establishments. An individual who works multiple jobs at separate establishments would have each job included in the number of employees.
